tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE market_data (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    symbol VARCHAR(50),
    date DATE,
    open_price DECIMAL(10,2),
    high_price DECIMAL(10,2),
    low_price DECIMAL(10,2),
    close_price DECIMAL(10,2),
    volume INT
);

CREATE TABLE market_data (
    date DATE,
    symbol TEXT,
    open_price DECIMAL,
    close_price DECIMAL,
    high_price DECIMAL,
    low_price DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE market_data (
  data_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  symbol VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  price NUMERIC NOT NULL,
  volume INT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE price_trends (
  trend_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  symbol VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  trend_type VARCHAR(20),
  trend_date DATE,
  trend_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE volatility_data (
  volatility_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  symbol VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  daily_volatility NUMERIC,
  weekly_volatility NUMERIC,
  monthly_volatility NUMERIC
);

CREATE TABLE historical_prices (
    date DATE,
    ticker_symbol VARCHAR(10),
    open_price DECIMAL(10, 2),
    close_price DECIMAL(10, 2),
    high_price DECIMAL(10, 2),
    low_price DECIMAL(10, 2)
);

CREATE TABLE MarketData (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    symbol TEXT NOT NULL,
    date DATE NOT NULL,
    open_price DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
    close_price DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
    volume INT NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE PriceTrends (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    symbol TEXT NOT NULL,
    trend_category TEXT NOT NULL,
    start_date DATE NOT NULL,
    end_date DATE NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE Volatility (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    symbol TEXT NOT NULL,
    volatility_rate DECIMAL(5,2) NOT NULL,
    volatility_category TEXT NOT NULL,
    date DATE NOT NULL
);
